title: Well there be balance changes in 5.19?
body:
Seems kind of odd that the first two days of the cycle have had no balance changes (other than gutting Devourer for range champions).

I'd like to know if there will be any champion changes this patch.

replies.body: 5.18 update was only yesterday, why do you have to ask now?

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eKxcoxEk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-16T22:36:25.876+0000)
>
> 5.18 update was only yesterday, why do you have to ask now?

Because we've already had two updates on the new pbe cycle, and usually we would have had champion changes by now.

> [{quoted}](name=DJ Di0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eKxcoxEk,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-09-16T22:37:18.582+0000)
>
> Because we've already had two updates on the new pbe cycle, and usually we would have had champion changes by now.

Its certainly possible most of the champions they plan on changing this patch, could be ones they're waiting to see how previous buffs / nerfs affect them.

E.g: It would be a pretty bad move to change Darius now, before you've had a chance to properly assess how his nerfs affected him.
There'll be some, it'll be smaller than the average patch though. We've shifted a lot of focus onto work for the large preseason patch later in the year.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eKxcoxEk,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-17T06:03:25.309+0000)
>
> There'll be some, it'll be smaller than the average patch though. We've shifted a lot of focus onto work for the large preseason patch later in the year.

Any context on why Vayne was completely let off the hook in 5.18? And will she be touched at all in 5.19? 

It's kinda of ridiculous when a supposed "high-skill champion" is the most picked champion and still has a strong win rate.

I'm assuming this has something to do with minimising the changes between 5.18 and future patches until after Worlds So it doesn't screw with training too much? Or is there sufficient balance right now to keep the game ticking until the sweeping changes?
LCS servers usually gets before worlds. They will likely play on 5.18 without changes.

> [{quoted}](name=Duke Anax,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eKxcoxEk,comment-id=000100030000,timestamp=2015-09-17T20:46:43.589+0000)
>
> LCS servers usually gets before worlds. They will likely play on 5.18 without changes.

I'm talking about their live training during the week, SoloQ and scrims that the teams continue to conduct through the Worlds Tournament - by reducing changes between 5.18 and 5.19/5.20, Riot would reduce the amount of disparity between what they have to train on in a live environment and what they're playing on competitively.
I think they have special environment for practice too.

They can scrim on a separate server generally, for pre-arranged 5v5s. But their soloQ practice pretty much has to happen on live to have a sufficient pool of players, assuming they choose to do Solo Q while travelling around Europe. I'd assume they would given that Groups will take awhile

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eKxcoxEk,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-17T06:03:25.309+0000)
>
> There'll be some, it'll be smaller than the average patch though. We've shifted a lot of focus onto work for the large preseason patch later in the year.

Ah, I see. 

If I may ask, will Miss Fortune's 'follow up' changes be scheduled for pre-season patch?

do you think Darius is fine now? or plan to do the flat+missing thing?

I hope his winrate drops cuz I cannot stand not being able to play him in ranked D:


Edit I would guess its too early to tell since patch came out for nearly just one day.
Just want an aatrox buff and I'm set :P I suppose the juggernauts are somewhat tame now so I wouldn't expect too many changes
